DataElement.preferredName: Assay Kit Sequencing Target Region BED Format Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The procedure and set of reagents to used to conduct a molecular assay which characterizes the content of a specific set of genomic intervals in a tab-delimited text file format (BED file format).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Assay Kit Sequencing Target Region BED Format
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A packaged system consisting of the main component materials necessary to perform one or more designated diagnostic tests or procedures._A specific region in the genome or in a gene of interest that is chosen for sequencing by the use of appropriate primers._A tab-delimited text file format that allows the specification of the sequence data that is displayed in an annotation track. The minimum required information is chromosome, start position, and end position.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A packaged system consisting of the main component materials necessary to perform one or more designated diagnostic tests or procedures.

Concepts.definition: A packaged system consisting of the main component materials necessary to perform one or more designated diagnostic tests or procedures.

Property.preferredDefinition: A specific region in the genome or in a gene of interest that is chosen for sequencing by the use of appropriate primers.:A tab-delimited text file format that allows the specification of the sequence data that is displayed in an annotation track. The minimum required information is chromosome, start position, and end position.

Concepts.definition: A specific region in the genome or in a gene of interest that is chosen for sequencing by the use of appropriate primers.

A tab-delimited text file format that allows the specification of the sequence data that is displayed in an annotation track. The minimum required information is chromosome, start position, and end position.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
